lead_paragraph: Senior officials warned the F.B.I. director on policies against talking about current criminal investigations or being seen as meddling in elections.

byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo and Adam Goldman reported from Washington, and Michael S. Schmidt and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Noah Weiland contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MATT APUZZO, ADAM GOLDMAN, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

headline.print_headline: Justice Dept.  Warned F.B.I. About Timing
headline.main: Justice Dept. Strongly Discouraged Comey on Move in Clinton Email Case

snippet: Senior officials warned the F.B.I. director on policies against talking about current criminal investigations or being seen as meddling in elections....
abstract: Justice Dept officials say they strongly discouraged Federal Bureau of Investigation director James B Comey from sending letter to Congress suggesting newly discovered emails could be relevant to Hillary Clinton server probe; opinion is divided over both exact motivation for and fallout from atypical and potentially illegal move, which has thrown presidential campaign into turmoil days before election.
